name: Calling in Your Tab
description: Has the Federation taken more than its fair share of the galactic pie? There are certainly some groups who think so and the opulence of the Convergence Day celebrations has prompted them to collect!
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In a Voyage Event, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each Encounter: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance in contests.
-- Using Birthday Cake Reed, any version of Kim, Stamets, Data, or Festive crew will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points.
-- Using the U.S.S. Titan, the U.S.S. Cochrane, the Ferengi D'Kora Marauder, or ships with the Warship trait will provide a bonus to antimatter.
-- Earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Warship (Ship trait), Birthday Cake Reed, Kim, Stamets, Data, or Festive

featured_crew.name: McCoy
featured_crew.flavor: McCoy must testify in Kirk's criminal negligence investigation, even if he does so defiantly.

featured_crew.name: Stamets
featured_crew.flavor: The dangerous journeys are over and the best ending to it all is sharing the happiness of your longtime colleague and friend at his wedding.

featured_crew.name: Data
featured_crew.flavor: In honor of Riker's and Deanna's “conjugation” Data took the stage and gave a performance that blew everybody away.

action.name: Oh, Blue Skies, Smiling at Meeee

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: McCoy
rewards.flavor: McCoy must testify in Kirk's criminal negligence investigation, even if he does so defiantly.

rewards.name: Data
rewards.flavor: In honor of Riker's and Deanna's “conjugation” Data took the stage and gave a performance that blew everybody away.

screens.text: "Happy Convergence Day to one and all! And what better way to celebrate the opening of hundreds of anomalies than by sharing a drink with friends new and old at Quark's--"

"You can drop the act now, Quark. Attention, Federation and all those foolish enough to call themselves its allies. We're calling in your tab. You've been a thorn in the galaxy's side for long enough now."

"It's so easy for you to cruise into other factions' territories, impose your own morals, take what you want as some sort of exception, then turn around and rub it in our faces with parties like this. Hypocrites, all of you! But we're taking back what's ours!"
"If your Federation wants entertainment, we'll give you a show the likes of which you've never seen! There will be no quarter for any Starfleet or Starfleet-allied vessel!"
"Happy Convergence Day to one and all! And what better way to celebrate the opening of hundreds of anomalies than by sharing a drink with friends new and old at Quark's--"

"You can drop the act now, Quark. Attention, Federation and all those foolish enough to call themselves its allies. We're calling in your tab. You've been a thorn in the galaxy's side for long enough now."

"It's so easy for you to cruise into other factions' territories, impose your own morals, take what you want as some sort of exception, then turn around and rub it in our faces with parties like this. Hypocrites, all of you! But we're taking back what's ours!"
"If your Federation wants entertainment, we'll give you a show the likes of which you've never seen! There will be no quarter for any Starfleet or Starfleet-allied vessel!"
"Welcome back, Captain. It looks like you managed to clear out some of the riff-raff. We were just trying to get this little snake here to tell us what he knows."

"Snake?! I'll have you know that, not only will I be pursuing a defamation suit against you for slander, but I'll see to it you'll never see a promotion as long as I live. I demand to speak to your commanding officer!"

responses.text: "The jig is up, Quark. You might as well tell us what's really going on."
"What have you all learned so far."
"I have friends in Starfleet Intelligence who are skilled at interrogations."

screens.text: "Enough of the theatrics, you little creep. We know your comm channel wasn't hacked by Brunt and the others like you first claimed. You can give us answers, or I can send you to spend a day in the Mirror Universe on the I.S.S. Charon."

"I told you, I'm an innocent victim in all this...even if I did hear inklings of a little revolt against the Federation in the lead-up to Convergence Day. Seems some out there think you all are celebrating too hard when they see you as the cause for a lot of the galaxy's woes."

"That interruption was no accident; we have proof Quark contacted Brunt before he went live. Not only that, but we have records of comms between Brunt, the Durases, the Emerald Chain, the Borg, and other hostile entities, even if the contents are unable to be decrypted."
"I have rights, you know! The Grand Nagus will hear of this! You think you have your hands full now? Just wait until I bury you all in a starship's weight in legal paperwork!"

"Convergence Day or not, we can't allow open season on all Starfleet ships to continue. If we don't put this to rest now, everyone who has a slight problem with the Federation will think it's all right to do what they want to us."
"Welcome back, Captain. It looks like you managed to clear out some of the riff-raff. We were just trying to get this little snake here to tell us what he knows."
